results.title: Bullfight
results.brief_description: Anna Sokolow recreates and reacts to a remembered bullfight and through her dancing recaptures her feelings while watching the fight. The climax is reached when the dancer identifies with the bullfighter, the bull and the death in the ring.

results.title: Bullets over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Magnolia Productions, Sweetland Films BV, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: A struggling writer gets the opportunity of his life to stage his latest play on Broadway. There is one catch however: he must cast the untalented mistress of a notorious gangster in the lead role. Overwhelmed by the chance of success, he overlooks critical factors looming in the wings, including a player who can’t act, a leading lady wanting to steal the spotlight, a leading man who is a compulsive eater and the gangster’s bodygaurd who wants to rewrite the play. Set in the 1920’s, Woody Allen’s film is enhanced by an excellent atmospheric soundtrack. The cast includes John Cusack, Mary-Louise Parker, Jennifer Tilly, Tracey Ullman, and Academy Award winner Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Bullet in the head
results.creator_credit: Golden Princess Film Production Ltd, John Woo Film Productions and John Woo
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnam war and focusing on the lives of three life-long friends, this film has been described as an ‘Eastern Deer Hunter’. In 1967 the three young men, fugitives from the Hong Kong police, set up a black-market operation in war-torn Saigon. Almost immediately after their arrival they run into trouble and forced to flee Saigon when they are captured by the Vietcong and taken to a prisoner-of-war camp. Thrown together in extreme conditions, they turn on each other as lust, betrayal and greed threaten to shatter their closeness. Made in the year following the Tiannamen Square Massacre, the film focuses on the strain that relationships undergo in times of strife, and the brutality of the war in Vietnam. Named by Woo as his personal favorite, it features his trademark combination of ballistic gun action and pathos around the theme of homosocial bonding. Cast includes Tony Leung, Jacky Cheung and Simon Yam. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Bull Durham
results.creator_credit: Mount Company, Thom Mount, Mark Burg and Ron Shelton
results.brief_description: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins turn in seriously sexy performances in this sensational baseball comedy. Charged with pulling the Durham Bulls ou of the longest losing streak in Carolina’s Baseball League history, Crash Davis’ (Costner) main challenge is to instruct, insult and inspire Eddie ‘Nuke’ Calvin (Robbins), their indisciplined but bullet-fast pitcher. Sarandon is the team’s groupie-cum-English Lit teacher who becomes the fly in the ointment after she catches Nuke’s eye and begins to distract him from Crash’s tuition with her own slightly bizarre set of off-field rules.

results.title: Bull ant warriors
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Study of the chemistry and behaviour of the Australian Red Bull Ant being undertaken by a research team in which a colony of ants is re-established in the laboratory under controlled conditions. Using close-up photography, dissection techniques and behavioural experiments research is undertaken in developing methods of control by other than chemical means. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Bulgaria: the land and the people
results.brief_description: Shows Bulgaria as a nation with a mixed heritage of Slavic, Greek, Turkish and Russian influences. There are still many reminders of these past civilisations. Under a communist government efforts have been made over the years to modernise industry and improve educational facilities and training.

results.title: Buildings and Bushfires-Improving the Chances of Survival
results.creator_credit: Television Production Unit and University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Bushfires are an inevitable hazard in Australia. The tranquillity of the bush belies its potential to burn fiercely when conditions are suitable. This program shows how bushfires start fires in buildings, how embers, radiation and flame, aided by wind cause ignition and destruction of buildings; that embers are the most important means of ignition; that well-designed buildings have a very good chance of survival; and that such buildings will provide a safer place of refuge for people in bushfires.
results.title_for_label: Buildings and Bushfires-Improving the Chances of Survival

results.title: Building Victoria's 500KV System
results.brief_description: In 1964 when Victoria decided to build the 500KV System to bring power from the LaTrobe Valley to Melbourne, this was the first such system in Australia well before the building started, testing and planning was done.

results.title: Building typing skill
results.brief_description: Examines methods pf improving typing performance by improving attitude, typing form, muscle tone, and tying patters - all important factors in increasing typing speed.

results.title: Building the industrial revolution
results.creator_credit: Link Film Services and Mick Gold
results.brief_description: A film about the elements that created the factory system, the buildings that housed it, and the social changes that it generated - a story told by the industrial architecture of the East Midlands, the area in which the first factories were built.
